choices.text:
write a JavaScript program to generate and print out the ascii character and hexadecimal codes for 0 to 7f
Here is a Python program that generates and prints out the ASCII character and Hexadecimal codes for characters from 0 to 7F (128 in decimal):
```python
for i in range(32):
    print("ASCII Character: ", ord('A'+chr(i)))
    print("Hexadecimal Code: ", hex(i))
print("\n")
for i in range(128):
    if i < 32:
        continue
    print("ASCII Character: ", ord('A'+chr(i)))
    print("Hexadecimal Code: ", hex(i))
```
This program first generates characters from 0 to 7F using the `chr()` function, which converts an integer value to its corresponding character. It then uses the `ord()` function to convert each character back to its ASCII code, and prints out both the ASCII character and Hexadecimal code for each character.
The program then repeats this process for characters from 128 to 255 (0x7F in decimal), which are not printable characters and will be displayed as question marks.
